abstract: Sophisticated book storage bunker extending from below main branch of New York Public Library on Fifth Avenue to area below Bryant Park includes miniature railroad for ferrying books back and forth; library staff is enchanted with $2.6 million system of little red train cars.
lead_paragraph: The New York Public Library’s “book train” at the main branch in Midtown serves the new underground stacks, which library officials call one of the most sophisticated book archives in the world.
snippet: The New York Public Library’s “book train” at the main branch in Midtown serves the new underground stacks, which library officials call one of the most sophisticated book archives in the world....

headline.main: Below Bryant Park, a Bunker and a Train Line, Just for Books
headline.print_headline: A Bunker With a Little Railroad, Just for Books
